summary: This document is a criminal history record inquiry response from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services, likely pertaining to an individual associated with the Epstein case. It includes standard criminal history summary information, warnings about data use, and notes that identification was not based on fingerprint comparison.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: Listed as the executive deputy commissioner of the agency providing the criminal history record.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St. Albany, New York 12210
keyFacts: This is a criminal history record (rap sheet) inquiry response from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services.
The document includes a caution that identification was not based on fingerprint comparison.
The record indicates the subject has information maintained by other states or in multiple NYS files maintained by the FBI available through the Interstate Identification Index.
There is a warning about unauthorized release of information being prohibited by federal law (Title 42 USC 3789g(b)).
The document references a sentencing note for charges where an individual is sentenced June 1, 1981 or later.
